snippet: The opening weekend ticket-sales total for that movie has been the biggest in history for a horror film, not accounting for inflation.
lead_paragraph: North American moviegoers were in the mood to be scared over the weekend, powering the micro-budgeted "Paranormal Activity 3" to a stronger-than-anticipated $54 million in ticket sales. That total, easily enough for No. 1, prompted Paramount Pictures, the studio behind this wildly successful horror franchise, to shriek with delight, or at least superlatives. (According to Paramount, the opening weekend total for "Paranormal Activity 3," which cost just $5 million to make, is the biggest in history for a horror film -- not accounting for inflation.) The studio partly attributed strong sales to strikingly positive reviews, which helped draw more moviegoers in their 30s and 40s.
